title: Under the Hawthorn Tree
author: Marita Conlon-McKenna
description: The story of three children who set out on a journey to find their relatives during the Irish Potato Famine.

title: Wildflower Girl
author: Marita Conlon-McKenna
description: The sequel to 'Under the Hawthorn Tree', this book follows Eily as she travels to America in search of a better life.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
author: Roald Dahl
description: The story of young Charlie Bucket inside the chocolate factory of eccentric chocolatier Willy Wonka.

title: Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator
author: Roald Dahl
description: Charlie and Willy Wonka travel in the Great Glass Elevator to outer space.

title: Danny the Champion of the World
author: Roald Dahl
description: Danny and his father outwit their wealthy neighbor by poaching his pheasants.

title: Esio Trot
author: Roald Dahl
description: A love story between two elderly people and a clever tortoise trick.

title: Fantastic Mr. Fox
author: Roald Dahl
description: Mr. Fox and his animal friends outwit their human farmers to steal food.

title: Georgeâ€™s Marvelous Medicine
author: Roald Dahl
description: George creates a magical medicine to deal with his horrible grandmother.

title: James and the Giant Peach
author: Roald Dahl
description: James escapes from his aunts and has magical adventures inside a giant peach.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: Matilda discovers her telekinetic powers and deals with her unkind family and headmistress.

title: The BFG
author: Roald Dahl
description: Sophie and the Big Friendly Giant set out to stop the other giants from eating children.

title: The Giraffe and the Pelly and Me
author: Roald Dahl
description: A boy joins a giraffe, a pelican, and a monkey in a window-cleaning business.

title: The Magic Finger
author: Roald Dahl
description: A girl with a magic finger transforms her neighbors into birds.

title: The Twits
author: Roald Dahl
description: A cruel couple play nasty tricks on each other until the animals they mistreat take revenge.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, the totalitarian nation of Panem is divided into 12 districts and the Capitol. Each year two young representatives from each district are selected by lottery to participate in The Hunger Games. Part entertainment, part brutal retribution for a past rebellion, the televised games are broadcast throughout Panem. The 24 participants are forced to eliminate their competitors while the citizens of Panem are required to watch.

title: Catching Fire
author: Suzanne Collins
description: Against all odds, Katniss Everdeen has won the annual Hunger Games with fellow district tribute Peeta Mellark. But it was a victory won by defiance of the Capitol and their harsh rules. Katniss and Peeta should be happy. After all, they have just won for themselves and their families a life of safety and plenty. But there are rumors of rebellion among the subjects, and Katniss and Peeta, to their horror, are the faces of that rebellion.

title: Mockingjay
author: Suzanne Collins
description: Against all odds, Katniss Everdeen has survived the Hunger Games twice. But now that she's made it out of the bloody arena alive, she's still not safe. The Capitol is angry. The Capitol wants revenge. Who do they think should pay for the unrest? Katniss. And what's worse, President Snow has made it clear that no one else is safe either. Not Katniss's family, not her friends, not the people of District 12.
